page.title: 06Fraserburgh Fish Market
page.content: Fraserburgh fish market was built in 1964.It is about 100 feet long and an extension is planned. The fish market has about 120 workers.The daily sale is at 7.30 am and sometimes if there are a lot of fish there is one at 9 am.On a Friday there is an extra one at 2.30 pm. The fish buyers can contact their office or company by cordless telephone or by 3 telephone boxes inside the market. The prices vary.For large lemon soles you would be Â£7 to Â£12 per stone so you would be about Â£108 for a 9 stone box of fish.Small lemon soles are Â£4 to Â£8 per stone. On 17/5/85 these are the numbers of boxes of different fish landed: haddock-225,whiting-70,cod-135,ling-3, monk-40,coley-30,dog fish-13, flat fish-100.
